org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager

Class RMInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.RMInitializer

  • public class RMInitializer
extends Object
    RMInitializer is used to initialize property for the Resource Manager start up.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 2.0

      • setProActiveConfiguration

        public void setProActiveConfiguration(String filePath)
        Set the ProActive configuration file to be used. This file is used to define the behavior of ProActive.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the absolute file path to the PA configuration file to use.
        See Also:
        for more details.

      • setJavaSecurityPolicy

        public void setJavaSecurityPolicy(String filePath)
        Set the java security policy file to be used. This is exactly what you would put in the "java.security.policy" property.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the absolute file path to the java security policy file to use.

      • setLog4jConfiguration

        public void setLog4jConfiguration(String filePath)
        Set the log4j configuration file to be used on this instance.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the absolute file path to the log4j configuration file to use.
        See Also:
        for more details.

      • setRMHomePath

        public void setRMHomePath(String homeDir)
        Set the home directory for the Resource Manager. This property is used to resolve every relative paths in the configuration file.

        You can leave this property without value if every specified paths are absolute in the configuration file. The default value is the current directory.

        Parameters:
        homeDir - the home directory of Resource Manager. (used to resolve relative path)

      • setResourceManagerPropertiesConfiguration

        public void setResourceManagerPropertiesConfiguration(String filePath)
        Set the RM Property configuration file. This is the main file that contains every RM properties. THIS PROPERTY MUST BE SET.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the absolute file path to Resource Manager properties file.
